intro: Acianthopsis oxyglossa, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
